author: Shiv Sunny
text: The Juvenile Justice Act 2015, which will be applicable to the Delhi teenager who is accused of committing two murders, states that if a heinous crime is committed by a person above the age of 16, the JJB “shall conduct a preliminary assessment with regard to his mental and physical capacity to commit such offence, ability to understand the consequences of the offence and the circumstances in which he allegedly committed the offence”. For the assessment, the board may take the assistance of “experienced psychologists or psycho-social workers or other experts”. This assessment is not to be mistaken for a trial. Lawyers say the change in rule will not impact the crime scenario.
title: Experts may assess teen
